subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Later Joseph of Arimathea asked Pilate for the body of Jesus. Now Joseph was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly because he feared the Jews. With Pilate's permission, he came and took the body away. He was accompanied by Nicodemus, the man who earlier had visited Jesus at night. Nicodemus brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about seventy-five pounds. (John 19:38, 39)
reflection: Four people were changed in the process of Jesus' death: The criminal, dying on the cross beside Jesus, asked Jesus to include him in His kingdom (Luke 23:39-43) The Roman officer proclaimed that Jesus was surely the Son of God (Mark 15:39) Joseph and Nicodemus, members of the Jewish high council and secret followers of Jesus (John 7:50-52), came out of hiding. These men were changed more by Jesus' death than by His life. they realized who Jesus was, and that realization brought out their belief, proclamation, and action. When confronted with Jesus death, we too should be changed~~~ to believe, to proclaim, and to act.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for what Your sacrifice on the cross means to every believer. I thank You for the change it made in my life. Help me each day to remain faithful to You in all things. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~~~~(food for thought)~~~To forgive is to set a prisoner free and
discover the prisoner was you. (see Mt 6:14, 15)

Our Meditation for Today:

Later Joseph of Arimathea asked Pilate for the body of Jesus. Now Joseph
was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly because he feared the Jews. With Pilate's
permission, he came and took the body away...He was accompanied by
Nicodemus, the man who earlier had visited Jesus at night. Nicodemus brought 
a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about seventy-five pounds...(Jn. 19:38, 39)

Our Thought for Today:

Four people were changed in the process of Jesus' death:

The criminal, dying on the cross beside Jesus, asked Jesus to include
him in His kingdom (Lk. 23:39-43)

The Roman officer proclaimed that Jesus was surely the Son of God
(Mk. 15:39)

Joseph and Nicodemus, members of the Jewish high council and secret
followers of Jesus (Jn. 7:50-52), came out of hiding.

These men were changed more by Jesus' death than by His life...
they realized who Jesus was, and that realization brought out their
belief, proclamation, and action...

When confronted with Jesus death, we too should be changed~~~
to believe, to proclaim, and to act...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Lord, I thank You for what Your sacrifice on the cross 
means to every believer. I thank You for the change it made 
in my life...Help me each day to remain faithful to You in all
things...Amen.

Keep looking up, all things are possible when we trust in Him...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Taking Jesus' body, the two of them, (Joseph of Arimathea, and Nicodemus) wrapped it, with the spices, in strips of linen. This was in accordance with Jewish burial customs. At the place where Jesus was crucified, there was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb, in which no one had even laid. Because it was the Jewish day of Preparation and since the tomb was nearby, they laid Jesus there. (John 19:40-42)
reflection: These two men were secret followers of Jesus. They were afraid to make thier allegiance known because of their positions in the Jewish community. Joseph was a leader and honored member of the Jewish high council. Nicodemus, also a member of the high council, had come to Jesus by night (John 3:1) and later tried to defend him before the other religious leaders (John 7:50-52). Yet they risked their reputations to provide for Jesus' burial. Are you a secret believer?? Do you hide your faith from your friends and fellow workers?? This is an appropriate time~~~just maybe your last chance, to step out of hiding and let others know whom you follow.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to ever be faithful in letting my light shine for you, for we know not what tomorrow may bring. I pray that men of your choosing would be voted into office. I pray that all believers who are voting would seek first godly wisdom. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~(food for thought)...The company that you keep will determine
the trouble you meet...(see Pro. 22:24, 25)

Our Meditation for Today:

Taking Jesus' body, the two of them, (Joseph of Arimathea, and Nicodemus) wrapped
it, with the spices, in strips of linen. This was in accordance with Jewish burial customs.

At the place where Jesus was crucified, there was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb, 
in which no one had even laid.

Because it was the Jewish day of Preparation and since the tomb was nearby, they laid 
Jesus there...(Jn 19:40-42)

Our Thought for Today:

These two men were secret followers of Jesus. They were afraid to make thier allegiance
known because of their positions in the Jewish community...

Joseph was a leader and honored member of the Jewish high council.
Nicodemus, also a member of the high council, had come to Jesus by night (Jn. 3:1)
and later tried to defend him before the other religious leaders (Jn. 7:50-52).

Yet they risked their reputations to provide for Jesus' burial...

Are you a secret believer?? Do you hide your faith from your friends and fellow workers??

This is an appropriate time~~~just maybe your last chance, to step out of hiding and let 
others know whom you follow...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to ever be faithful in letting my light shine for you,
for we know not what tomorrow may bring...I pray that men of your choosing would
be voted into office...I pray that all believers who are voting would seek first godly
wisdom...Amen.

Keep looking up, let us remain faithful at all times...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb and saw that the stone had been removed from the entrance. So she came running to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one Jesus loved, and said, "They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don't know where they have put Him!" So Peter and the other disciple started for the tomb. Both were running, but the other disciple out ran Peter and reached the tomb first. He bent over and looked in at the strips of linen lying there but didn't go in. Then Simon Peter, who was behind him, arrived and went into the tomb, he saw the strips of linen lying there, as well as the burial cloth that had been around Jesus' head. The cloth was folded up by itself, separate from the linen. Finally the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, also went inside. He saw and believed. (John 20:1-8)
reflection: John the most fleet of foot reached the tomb first, and so he bent over and looked in, but he did not, or could not cross the threshold. Some people who hear about the Resurrection for the first time often need time to comprehend the amazing story. often due to our daily walking in the world we become accustomed to seeing before believing. But sooner or latter we have to come to have faith, because we are going to have to believe in certain things even though they are yet unseen. So the question that stands before us today is, "Do you have faith?"
prayer: Dear Lord, who art the Creator and Master of everything, create in me true and lasting faith. Create in me a sensitivity to Your Holy Spirit's leading. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)~~~~To many parents are not on spanking
terms with their children. (see Pro. 13:24)

Our Meditation for Today:

Early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene went to the
tomb and saw that the stone had been removed from the entrance...

So she came running to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one Jesus loved,
and said, "They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don't know where they
have put Him!"

So Peter and the other disciple started for the tomb...

Both were running, but the other disciple out ran Peter and reached the tomb first...

He bent over and looked in at the strips of linen lying there but didn't go in...

Then Simon Peter, who was behind him, arrived and went into the tomb, he saw
the strips of linen lying there, as well as the burial cloth that had been around Jesus' head.
The cloth was folded up by itself, separate from the linen...

Finally the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, also went inside. He saw
and believed...(Jn 20:1-8)

Our Thought for Today:

John the most fleet of foot reached the tomb first, and so he bent over and looked in,
but he did not, or could not cross the threshold...

Some people who hear about the Resurrection for the first time often need time to
comprehend the amazing story...

often due to our daily walking in the world we become accustomed to seeing before
believing...But sooner or latter we have to come to have faith, because we are going 
to have to believe in certain things even though they are yet unseen...

So the question that stands before us today is, "Do you have faith?"

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Lord, who art the Creator and Master of everything, create in me
true and lasting faith. Create in me a sensitivity to Your Holy Spirit's 
leading...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to lead you...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Peter and John still did not understand from Scripture that Jesus had to rise from the dead. The disciples went back to their homes. (John 20:9, 10)
reflection: The disciples didn't totally understand the significance of all that had happened until Jesus appeared to them. Jesus' resurrection is the key to the Christian faith. Why? Because~~~ (1) Just as He said, Jesus rose from the dead. We can now be confident that He will accomplish all He has promised. (2) Jesus' bodily resurrection shows us that the living Christ, not a false prophet or impostor, is the ruler of God's eternal Kingdom. (3) We can be certain of our own resurrection because Jesus was resurrected. Death is not the end, there is a future life. (4) The divine power that brought Jesus back to life is now available to us to bring our spiritually dead selves back to life. (5) The Resurrection is the basis for the church's witness to the world. When someone comes to you looking for some comforting words in regards to there life after death, first share that Jesus died for the sins of the whole world and it is available to all who believe in His finished work one the cross. Then share the five points above.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the sacrifice you made for me on the cross. I thank you for the home you have prepared for me in paradise with you. Forgive me for my sins of thought word and deed. Cleanse my heart of all unrighteousness. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has 
the courage to lose sight of the shore. (see Mt. 14:28, 29)

Our Meditation for Today:

Peter and John still did not understand from Scripture that Jesus 
had to rise from the dead. The disciples went back to their homes...
(Jn 20:9, 10)

Our Thought for Today:

The disciples didn't totally understand the significance of all that had happened
until Jesus appeared to them...

Jesus' resurrection is the key to the Christian faith. Why? Because~~~

(1) Just as He said, Jesus rose from the dead. We can now be confident that 
He will accomplish all He has promised...

(2) Jesus' bodily resurrection shows us that the living Christ, not a false prophet or
imposter, is the ruler of God's eternal Kingdom...

(3) We can be certain of our own resurrection because Jesus was resurrected.
Death is not the end, there is a future life.

(4) The divine power that brought Jesus back to life is now available to us to bring
our spiritually dead selves back to life...

(5) The Resurrection is the basis for the church's witness to the world...

When someone comes to you looking for some comforting words in regards to there
life after death, first share that Jesus died for the sins of the whole world and it is available 
to all who believe in His finished work one the cross. Then share the five points above...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the sacrifice you made for me on the cross.
I thank you for the home you have prepared for me in paradise with you.
Forgive me for my sins of thought word and deed. Cleanse my heart of all
unrighteousness...Amen.

Keep looking up, He knows what is best for you...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Mary had just been speaking to two angels; Then she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not realize that it was Jesus."Woman, " He said, Why are you crying? Who is it you are looking for?" Thinking he was the gardener, she said, "Sir, if you have carried Him away, tell me where you have put Him, and I will get Him." Jesus said to her, "Mary." She turn toward him and cried out in Aramaic, "Rabboni!" (which means teacher) (John 20:14-16)
reflection: Mary didn't recognize Jesus at first. Her grief had blinded her, She couldn't see Him because she didn't expect to see Him. Then He spoke her name, and immediately she recognized Him. Can you imagine the love that flooded her heart when she heard her Savior saying her name. Jesus is near you, and He is calling your name. Can you, like Mary, regard Him as Your Lord?
prayer: Most Gracious Heavenly Father, Savior of the world, Creator of all that exists, In the midst of all that is going on in the world deliver Your people. May Your people recognize Your voice and draw near to You. May this country once again seek You in all things. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...The heart is the happiest when it
beats for others...(see Jn 15:13)

Our Meditation for Today:

Mary had just been speaking to two angels; Then she turned around and saw Jesus
standing there, but she did not realize that it was Jesus...

"Woman," He said, Why are you crying? Who is it you are looking for?" Thinking he 
was the gardener, she said, "Sir, if you have carried Him away, tell me where you have
put Him, and I will get Him."

Jesus said to her, "Mary." She turn toward him and cried out in Aramaic, "Rabboni!"
(which means teacher) (Jn 20:14-16)

Our Thought for Today:

Mary didn't recognize Jesus at first. Her grief had blinded her, She couldn't see Him because
she didn't expect to see Him. Then He spoke her name, and immediately she recognized Him...

Can you imagine the love that flooded her heart when she heard her Savior saying her name...

Jesus is near you, and He is calling your name. Can you, like Mary, regard Him as Your Lord?

Our Prayer for Today:

Most Gracious Heavenly Father, Savior of the world, Creator of all that exists,
In the midst of all that is going on in the world deliver Your people. May Your
people recognize Your voice and draw near to You. May this country once again
seek You in all things...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to be first in your life...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus said, "Do not hold on to Me, for I have not yet returned to the Father. Go instead to My brothers and tell them, 'I am returning to my Father and your Father, to MY God and your God. Mary Magdalene went to the disciples with the news: "I have seen the Lord!" And she told them that He had said these things to her. (John 20:17, 18)
reflection: Mary Magdalene did not meet the risen Christ until she had discovered the empty tomb. She responded with joy and obedience by going to tell the disciples. We too cannot meet Christ until we discover that He is indeed alive, that His tomb is indeed empty. So the ultimate question is, are you filled with joy by this good news, and do you share it with others.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always look upon this good news with joy. So often we Christians are accused of having horse faces, when we should have joy in our hearts. Help me to remember that as a Christian my life is being closely watched by those who can be very critical. I pray that my life would be a witness for You. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~(food for thought)~~~One thing you can learn by watching the clock is
that it passes time by keeping its hands busy. (see Pro. 18:9)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus said, "Do not hold on to Me, for I have not yet returned to the Father.
Go instead to My brothers and tell them, 'I am returning to my Father and your
Father, to MY God and your God...

Mary Magdalene went to the disciples with the news: "I have seen the Lord!"
And she told them that He had said these things to her. (Jn. 20:17, 18)

Our Thought for Today:

Mary Magdalene did not meet the risen Christ until she had discovered the empty
tomb. She responded with joy and obedience by going to tell the disciples...

We too cannot meet Christ until we discover that He is indeed alive, that His tomb
is indeed empty...

So the ultimate question is, are you filled with joy by this good news, and do you
share it with others...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always look upon this good news with joy.
So often we Christians are accused of having horse faces, when we should 
have joy in our hearts. Help me to remember that as a Christian my life is being
closely watched by those who can be very critical...I pray that my life would be a
witness for You...Amen.

Keep looking up, If God has brought you to it, He will bring you though it...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: JESUS APPEARS TO HIS DISCIPLES: Jesus again says, "Peace be with you! as the Father has sent Me, I am sending you." John 20:21)
reflection: Jesus has again identified himself with His Father. He tells His disciples by whose authority He did His work. Then He passed the job to His disciples of spreading the Good News of salvation around the world. Now we need to remember: (1) Our authority comes from God, and (2) Jesus has demonstrated by words and actions how to accomplish the job He has given to us. As the Father sent Jesus, Jesus sends His followers~~~every believer
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always remember to pick up the baton that You handed to every believer. As the Father sent You, and You went forward knowing what the end would bring You remained faithful, help me Lord to also remain faithful. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)...Now there's even a "dial-a-prayer" for atheists.
You call a number and nobody answers...(see Ps. 14:1a)

Our Meditation for Today:

JESUS APPEARS TO HIS DISCIPLES:

Jesus again says, "Peace be with you! as the Father has sent Me, 
I am sending you." Jn. 20:21)

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus has again identified himself with His Father. He tells His disciples by
whose authority He did His work...

Then He passed the job to His disciples of spreading the Good News of
salvation around the world...

Now we need to remember: (1) Our authority comes from God, and 
(2) Jesus has demonstrated by words and actions how to accomplish
the job He has given to us...

As the Father sent Jesus, Jesus sends His followers~~~every believer

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always remember to pick up the baton 
that You handed to every believer...As the Father sent You, and You went 
forward knowing what the end would bring You remained faithful, help me
Lord to also remain faithful...Amen.

Keep looking up, trust that He knows what is best...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus had just shared with His disciples their responsibility to go out. And with that He breathed on them and said, "receive the Holy Spirit." (John 20:22)
reflection: This may have been a special filling of the Holy Spirit for the disciples. a foretaste of what all believers would experience at the time of Pentecost (Acts 2) and forever after. To do God's work, we need the guidance and power of the Holy Spirit. We must avoid trying to do His work in our own strength.
prayer: Most Gracious Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Holy Spirit's power. Forgive me for running out ahead of You in seeking to share the Good News. Help me to always remember that my works alone are no more than filthy rags (Isaiah 64:6). Anoint me with Your Holy Spirit's power for I ask it in Jesus name. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)...He who thinks by the inch and talks by the yard
deserves to be kicked by the foot...(see Pro. 18:6)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus had just shared with His disciples their responsibility to go out.
And with that He breathed on them and said, "receive the Holy Spirit." (Jn. 20:22)

Our Thought for Today:

This may have been a special filling of the Holy Spirit for the disciples.
a foretaste of what all believers would experience at the time of Pentecost
(Acts 2) and forever after...

To do God's work, we need the guidance and power of the Holy Spirit.
We must avoid trying to do His work in our own strength...

Our Prayer for Today:

Most Gracious Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Holy Spirit's power.
Forgive me for running out ahead of You in seeking to share the Good News.
Help me to always remember that my works alone are no more than filthy
rags (Isa 64:6). Anoint me with Your Holy Spirit's power for I ask it in Jesus
name...Amen.

Keep looking up, all things are possible with Him...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: After Jesus had bestowed the Holy Spirit upon His disciples He says to them: "If you forgive anyone his sins, they are forgiven; if you do not forgive them, they are not forgiven." (John 20:23)
reflection: Jesus was giving the disciples their Spirit-powered and Spirit-guided mission, to preach the Good News about Jesus so peoples sins might be forgiven. The Disciples did not have the actual power to forgive sins (only God can forgive sins), but Jesus gave them the privilege of telling new believers that their sins have been forgiven because they had accepted Jesus message. (see Matthew 16:19) All believers have this same privilege. We can announce forgiveness of sins with certainty when we ourselves have found repentance and faith.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the assurance that You do forgive our sins. And we can draw this assurance from your words in Romans 10:9 where it says, "That if you confess with your mouth Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised Him from the dead, you will be saved. In faith given to me by the Holy Spirit I do believe that Jesus is Lord and so confess. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~(food for thought)...The best inheritance a father can leave his
children is a good example. (see I Thess. 2:11)

Our Meditation for Today:

After Jesus had bestowed the Holy Spirit upon His disciples He says to them:
"If you forgive anyone his sins, they are forgiven; if you do not forgive them, they
are not forgiven." (Jn. 20:23)

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus was giving the disciples their Spirit-powered and Spirit-guided mission,
to preach the Good News about Jesus so peoples sins might be forgiven...

The Disciples did not have the actual power to forgive sins (only God can forgive
sins), but Jesus gave them the privilege of telling new believers that their sins
have been forgiven because they had accepted Jesus message. (see Mt. 16:19)

All believers have this same privilege. We can announce forgiveness of sins with 
certainty when we ourselves have found repentance and faith...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the assurance that You do forgive our sins.
And we can draw this assurance from your words in Ro. 10:9 where it says, "That 
if you confess with your mouth Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God 
raised Him from the dead, you will be saved. In faith given to me by the Holy Spirit
I do believe that Jesus is Lord and so confess...Amen.

Keep looking up, keep plugging away for Jesus...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Now Thomas (called Didymus, one of the twelve, was not with the disciples when Jesus came. So the other disciples told him, "We have seen the Lord!" But he told them, "Unless I see the nail marks in His hands and put my finger where the nails were, and put my hand into His side, I will not believe it." (John 20:24, 25)
reflection: Have you ever wished you could actually see Jesus, touch Him, and hear His words? Are there times you would like to sit down with Him and get His advice? Thomas wanted Jesus' physical presence. But God's plan is wiser. He has not limited Himself to one physical body; He wants to be present with you at all times. Even now He is with you in the form of the Holy Spirit. You can talk to Him, and you can find His words to you in the pages of the Bible. He can be as real to you as He was to Thomas.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the avenue of prayer and that the line is always open. I thank You that You know our needs before we even open our mouth. But I truly have to confess, that there are times when it would be really nice to talk to someone with skin on. Bless and protect our service men, and be with their families. Give wisdom to our countries leaders. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)...God intervenes in the affairs of men
by invitation only...(see Rev. 3:20)

Our Meditation for Today:

Now Thomas (called Didymus, one of the twelve, was not with the disciples 
when Jesus came. So the other disciples told him, "We have seen the Lord!"

But he told them, "Unless I see the nail marks in His hands and put my finger
where the nails were, and put my hand into His side, I will not believe it." (Jn 20:24, 25)

Our Thought for Today:

Have you ever wished you could actually see Jesus, touch Him, and hear His words?

Are there times you would like to sit down with Him and get His advice?

Thomas wanted Jesus' physical presence. But God's plan is wiser. He has not limited
Himself to one physical body; He wants to be present with you at all times...

Even now He is with you in the form of the Holy Spirit...

You can talk to Him, and you can find His words to you in the pages of the Bible.
He can be as real to you as He was to Thomas...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the avenue of prayer and that the line is 
always open. I thank You that You know our needs before we even open our
mouth. But I truly have to confess, that there are times when it would be really
nice to talk to someone with skin on...Bless and protect our service men, and 
be with their families...Give wisdom to our countries leaders...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is waiting to hear from you...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus returns: A week later His disciples were in the house again, and Thomas was with them. Though the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them and said."Peace be with you!" Then He said to Thomas, "Put your finger here; see my hands. Reach out you hand and put it into my side. Stop doubting and believe." Thomas said to Him, "My Lord and my God!" (John 20:26-28)
reflection: Jesus wasn't hard on Thomas for his doubts. Despite his skepticism, Thomas was still loyal to the believers and to Jesus Himself. Some people need to doubt before they will believe. If doubt leads to questions, questions lead to answers, and the answers are accepted, then doubt has done good work. It is when doubt becomes stubbornness and stubbornness becomes a lifestyle that doubt harms faith. When you doubt, don't stop there. Let your doubt deepen your faith as you continue to search for the answers.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, our creator and sustained, I pray that any doubts that may come my way would always be such that it would cause me to search for the truth, thus causing my faith in You to grow. May I grow each day in faithfulness to You. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)...A marriage may be made in heaven, but the
maintenance must be done on earth...(see Eph. 5:33)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus returns: A week later His disciples were in the house again, 
and Thomas was with them. Though the doors were locked, Jesus 
came and stood among them and said."Peace be with you!"

Then He said to Thomas, "Put your finger here; see my hands. Reach
out you hand and put it into my side. Stop doubting and believe."

Thomas said to Him, "My Lord and my God!" (Jn. 20 26-28)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus wasn't hard on Thomas for his doubts. Despite his skepticism, 
Thomas was still loyal to the believers and to Jesus Himself...

Some people need to doubt before they will believe. If doubt leads to questions,
questions lead to answers, and the answers are accepted, then doubt has done
good work.

It is when doubt becomes stubbornness and stubbornness becomes a life-style
that doubt harms faith...

When you doubt, don't stop there. Let your doubt deepen your faith as you 
continue to search for the answers...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, our creator and sustainer, I pray that any doubts 
that may come my way would always be such that it would cause me to 
search for the truth, thus causing my faith in You to grow...May I grow 
each day in faithfulness to You...Amen.

Keep looking up, trusting in His love and power...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus told Peter, "Because you have seen me, you have believed; blessed are those who have not seen yet have believed." (John 20:29)
reflection: Some people think they would believe in Jesus if they could see a definite sign or a miracle. But Jesus says we are blessed if we can believe without seeing. Really we have all the proof we need in the words of the Bible and the testimony of believers. A physical appearance would not make Jesus any more real to us then He is now.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I do thank You for Your Word~~~the Bible. For in it I find all the information I need to believe in Christ. I thank You for the proof of Your love and mercy which we also find written about in Your Word. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)...The grass may look greener on the other side,
but it still needs to be mowed...(see Heb. 13:5)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus told Peter, "Because you have seen me, you have believed;
blessed are those who have not seen yet have believed." (Jn. 20:29)

Our Thought for Today:

Some people think they would believe in Jesus if they could see a
definite sign or a miracle...

But Jesus says we are blessed if we can believe without seeing...

Really we have all the proof we need in the words of the Bible and
the testimony of believers...

A physical appearance would not make Jesus any more real to us 
then He is now...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I do thank You for Your Word~~~the Bible.
For in it I find all the information I need to believe in Christ...I thank
You for the proof of Your love and mercy which we also find written 
about in Your Word...Amen.

Keep looking up, for you are still in His love...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: John writes: Jesus did many other miraculous signs in the presence of His disciples, which are not recorded in this book. But these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in His name. (John 20:30, 31)
reflection: To understand the life and mission of Jesus more fully, all we need to do is study the Gospels. John tells us that his Gospel records only a few of the many events in Jesus' life on earth. But the Good News includes everything we need to know to believe that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, through whom we receive eternal life. What have you done with the Good News???
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the Gospels in Your Book. The most meaningful Good News to me is John 3:16 and John 20:31. Thank You Lord for this Good News. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)...Patience is the ability to keep your motor idling
when you feel like stripping your gears...(see Pro. 16:32)

Our Meditation for Today:

John writes: Jesus did many other miraculous signs in the presence of His disciples,
which are not recorded in this book. But these are written that you may believe that 
Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in His
name...(Jn. 20: 30, 31)

Our Thought for Today:

To understand the life and mission of Jesus more fully, all we need to do is study the 
Gospels. John tells us that his Gospel records only a few of the many events in Jesus'
life on earth...

But the Good News includes everything we need to know to believe that Jesus is the 
Messiah, the Son of God, through whom we receive eternal life...

What have you done with the Good News???

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the Gospels in Your Book.
The most meaningful Good News to me is John 3:16 and Jn. 20:31...
Thank You Lord for this Good News...Amen.

Keep looking up, there is no friend like Jesus...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus challenges Peter: When they had finished eating Jesus said to Simon Peter, "Simon son of John, do you truly love me more than these?" "Yes Lord, " he said, "You know that I love you." Jesus said, "feed my lambs." Again Jesus said, "Simon son of John, do you truly love Me?" He answered, "Yes, Lord, You know that I love You." Jesus said, "Take care of my sheep. The third time He said to him, "Simon son of John, do you Love me?" Peter was hurt because Jesus asked him the third time, "Do you love me?" He said, Lord, You know all things; You know that I love You." Jesus said, "Feed my sheep." (John 21:15-17)
reflection: Jesus led Peter through an experience that would remove the cloud of his denial. Peter had denied Jesus three times. Three times Jesus asked Peter if he loved Him. When Peter answered yes, Jesus told him to feed His sheep. It is one thing to say you love Jesus, but the real test is a willingness to serve Him. Peter had repented, and here Jesus was asking him to commit his life. Peter's life changed when he finally realized who Jesus was. His occupation changed from fisherman to evangelist; his denial changed from impetuous to "rock' and his relationship to Jesus changed--he was forgiven and he finally understood the significance of Jesus' words about His death and resurrection. How would you respond if Jesus asked you, "Do you love Me?" Do you really love Jesus? Are you even His friend?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that if my life should ever be threatened for knowing You, I would never deny You. Strengthen my faith and courage that I may not ever deny You. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)...He who is waiting for something to turn up might
start by turning up his own shirt sleeves...(see Pro. 14:23)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus challenges Peter: When they had finished eating Jesus said to Simon Peter, 
"Simon son of John, do you truly love me more than these?" "Yes Lord," he said, 
"You know that I love you." Jesus said, "feed my lambs."

Again Jesus said, "Simon son of John, do you truly love Me?" He answered, "Yes,
Lord, You know that I love You." Jesus said, "Take care of my sheep...

The third time He said to him, "Simon son of John, do you Love me?" Peter was hurt
because Jesus asked him the third time, "Do you love me?" He said, Lord, You
know all things; You know that I love You."

Jesus said,"Feed my sheep." (Jn. 21:15-17) 


Our Thought for Today:

Jesus led Peter through an experience that would remove the cloud of his denial.
Peter had denied Jesus three times. Three times Jesus asked Peter if he loved 
Him...When Peter answered yes, Jesus told him to feed His sheep...

It is one thing to say you love Jesus, but the real test is a willingness to serve Him...

Peter had repented, and here Jesus was asking him to commit his life. Peter's life 
changed when he finally realized who Jesus was. 

His occupation changed from fisherman to evangelist; his denial changed from 
impetuous to "rock' and his relationship to Jesus changed--he was forgiven and 
he finally understood the significance of Jesus' words about His death and resurrection.

How would you respond if Jesus asked you, "Do you love Me?" Do you really love
Jesus? Are you even His friend? 

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that if my life should ever be threatened
for knowing You, I would never deny You...Strengthen my faith and courage
that I may not ever deny You...Amen

Keep looking up, He may just have a blessing for you today...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus said, "I tell you the truth, when you were younger you dressed yourself and went where you wanted; but when you are old you will stretch out your hands and someone else will dress you and lead you where you do not want to go." Jesus said this to indicate the kind of death by which Peter would glorify God. then He said to him, "Follow Me!!!" (John 21:18-19)
reflection: Of course we already know that this was a prediction of Peter's death by crucifixion. Tradition indicates that Peter was crucified for his faith, upside down because he did not feel worthy of dying as His Lord did. Despite what Peter's future held, Jesus told him to follow Him. We may be uncertain and fearful about our future. But if we know God is in control, we can confidently follow Christ.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would always guide and direct me in the way You want me go. I thank You for the path You have lead me on in the past. Lead me in paths of righteousness. I thank You that You are in control, and that I can follow Christ in safety. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)...Many a good man has failed because he had his
wishbone where his backbone should have been...(see Jos. 1:9)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus said, "I tell you the truth, when you were younger you dressed yourself
and went where you wanted; but when you are old you will stretch out your hands
and someone else will dress you and lead you where you do not want to go."

Jesus said this to indicate the kind of death by which Peter would glorify God.
then He said to him, "Follow Me!!!" 

Our Thought for Today:

Of course we already know that this was a prediction of Peter's death by crucifixion.
Tradition indicates that Peter was crucified for his faith, upside down because he 
did not feel worthy of dying as His Lord did...

Despite what Peter's future held, Jesus told him to follow Him...

We may be uncertain and fearful about our future. But if we know God is in control,
we can confidently follow Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would always guide and direct me in the 
way You want me go...I thank You for the path You have lead me on in the past...
Lead me in paths of righteousness...I thank You that You are in control, and that 
I can follow Christ in safety...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is there to show you the way...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Peter asks Jesus how John would die. Jesus replies, "If I want Him to remain until I return, what is that to you? You must follow Me." (John 21:22)
reflection: Peter was concerned about Johns future, But Jesus tells Peter not to concern himself with that. So often we tend to compare our lives to others, sometime to rationalize our own level of devotion to Christ or to question God's justice. Jesus response to us as he did Peter. What is that to you?? You follow me!!
prayer: Dear Lord, make me mindful of the fact that each day has much to be thankful for not just this one day which we call Thanksgiving day. I thank Thee first of all for Your love and mercy~~then for family and friends~~for health and home~~for freedom of worship and speech and for eternal life in Christ. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)...The worship most acceptable to God comes from
a thankful and cheerful heart...(see Ps. 100:4, 5)

Our Meditation for Today:

Peter asks Jesus how John would die. Jesus replies, "If I want Him to remain 
until I return, what is that to you? You must follow Me." (Jn. 21:22)

Our Thought for Today:

Peter was concerned about Johns future, But Jesus tells Peter not to concern himself
with that...

So often we tend to compare our lives to others, sometime to rationalize our own level
of devotion to Christ or to question God's justice...

Jesus response to us as he did Peter... What is that to you?? You follow me!!

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Lord, make me mindful of the fact that each day has much to 
be thankful for not just this one day which we call Thanksgiving day.
I thank Thee first of all for Your love and mercy~~then for family and 
friends~~for health and home~~for freedom of worship and speech
and for eternal life in Christ...Amen.

Keep looking up, a grateful though toward heaven is of itself a prayer...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: In the past God spoke to our forefathers through the prophets at many times and in various ways. But in these last days He has spoken to us by His Son, whom He appointed heir of all things, and through whom He made the universe. (Hebrews 1:1, 2)
reflection: God used many approaches to send His message to people in the OT times. He spoke to Isaiahin visions~~(Isaiah 6), the Jacob in a dream~~(Genesis 28:10-22, and to Abrahan and Moses personally~~(Genesis 18; Exodus 31:18) Jewish people familiar with these stories would not have found it had to believe that God was still revealing His will, but it was astonishing for them to think, that God had revealed Himself by speaking trough His Son, Jesus Christ. Jesus is fulfillment and culmination of God's revelation through the centuries. When we know Him, we have all we need to be saved from our sin and to have a perfect relationship with God.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the wonderful gift of Your Son who went to there. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)...Your temper is like a fire. It gets very destructive
when it gets out of control...see Pro. 25:28)

(I will be working through the book of Hebrews now)

Our Meditation for Today:

In the past God spoke to our forefathers through the prophets at many times 
and in various ways...

But in these last days He has spoken to us by His Son, whom He appointed 
heir of all things, and through whom He made the universe...(Heb. 1:1, 2)

Our Thought for Today:

God used many approaches to send His message to people in the OT times...

He spoke to Isa. in vissions~~(Isa. 6), the Jacob in a dream~~(Gen.28:10-22, 
and to Abrahan and Moses personaly~~(Gen 18; Ex. 31:18)

Jewish people familiar with these stories would not have found it had to believe
that God was still revealing His will, but it was astonishing for them to think, that
God had revealed Himself by speaking trough His Son, Jesus Christ...

Jesus is fulfillment and culmination of God's revelation through the centuries...

When we know Him, we have all we need to be saved from our sin and to have
a perfect relationship with God...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the wonderful gift of Your Son
who went to there

reflection: God used many approaches to send His message to people in the OT times. He spoke to Isaiahin visions~~(Isaiah 6), the Jacob in a dream~~(Genesis 28:10-22, and to Abrahan and Moses personally~~(Genesis 18; Exodus 31:18) Jewish people familiar with these stories would not have found it had to believe that God was still revealing His will, but it was astonishing for them to think, that God had revealed Himself by speaking trough His Son, Jesus Christ. Jesus is fulfillment and culmination of God's revelation through the centuries. When we know Him, we have all we need to be saved from our sin and to have a perfect relationship with God.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for what Your Son did for me. I thank you for the message of salvation He brought to earth. I pray that His message would go forward through out the world. I ask this in His holy and precious name. Amen.
